intro: Eleogiton fascicularis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed eleogiton, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic plants such as parsley and carrots. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, compound leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are clustered in umbels, a typical feature of the Apiaceae family, and are usually white or pale yellow in color. Eleogiton fascicularis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
